stanza.line: As fast as thou shalt wane so fast thou growgrow
In one of thine from that which thou departestdepartest
And that fresh blood which youngly thou bestowbestow
Thou mayst call thine when thou from youth convertestconvertest
Herein lives wisdom beauty and increaseincrease
Without this folly age and cold decaydecay
If all were minded so the times should ceasecease
And threescore year would make the world awayaway
Let those whom nature hath not made for storestore
Harsh featureless and rude barrenly perishperish
Look whom she best endowed she gave thee moremore
Which bounteous gift thou shouldst in bounty cherishcherish
She carved thee for her seal and meant therebythereby
Thou shouldst print more not let that copy diedie
